comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Margarethe Arndt-Ober (1885–1971) was an American opera singer of German descent who had an active international career during the first half of the twentieth century. A highly skilled contralto[1], Ober enjoyed a particularly long and fruitful association with the Berlin State Opera from 1907 to 1944. She also was notably a principal singer at the Metropolitan Opera in New York City between 1913 and 1917. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Margarethe_Arndt-Ober
